conclusion: Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity with respect to time, corresponding to the slope of the v-t graph.
The v-t graph shows the velocity of object B as a function of time and is a curve indicating non-linear change.
From time 0 to t1, the graph of object B is curving downwards, indicating decreasing velocity.
The slope of the graph is negative during 0 to t1 because the velocity is decreasing.
The curve is concave upwards, suggesting the magnitude of negative acceleration is decreasing.
At t1, the graph reaches a minimum point, indicating velocity is momentarily zero.
After t1, the graph starts to curve upwards, indicating increasing velocity.
The slope of the graph becomes positive after t1, indicating positive acceleration.
The curve is concave upwards, suggesting the magnitude of positive acceleration is increasing.
Initially, the acceleration is negative and its magnitude decreases until t1.
After t1, the acceleration becomes positive and its magnitude increases until t2.

The trend of the acceleration of object B during the time interval from 0 to t2 is that it starts as negative, decreases in magnitude until t1, then becomes positive and increases in magnitude until t2.
